comments:
We define entities in separate files. One of it cannot be opened with any editor
(even the default text editor), since the file seems aways be parssed by the
internal wst xml parser, that creates a stack overflow reading the file. The
file itself can be used without any problems as include with system entities
running Maven, so basically the syntax is valid.

Created an attachment (id=26009)
dependencies.ent

The file with the entitiy definitions causing the StackOverflowError in the WST
XML parser.

Just as hint: The position printed from the parser seems currently the start of
the entitiy definition for the entity "dep-javamail", but adding/changing
elements in the file varies the location.

This is worse as originally thought. If I enable "Task Tags" for "Web and XML" I
get this error steadily.

The parser is tripping over the '<' characters in the entity, thinking instead
that it's beginning a tag.  It doesn't exit the entity-scanning area properly
afterward so the stack never gets popped.
